revised_title: Theoretical Solutions for Swirling Vortex Flows in Fluids
tldr: The article presents a family of exact solutions to the Navier-Stokes equations for an infinite vortex line in a viscous fluid interacting with a plane boundary. It describes three types of swirling vortex motions and discusses their implications for dynamic meteorology, particularly in explaining phenomena like tornadoes and water-spouts.
